bigshot
Class AbstractCubicTransform<Derived extends AbstractCubicTransform>

java.lang.Object
  bigshot.AbstractCubicTransform<Derived>
Type Parameters:
Derived - for subclasses, the most derived class name. Used to implement the method chaining for builder methods.
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractSphericalCubicTransform
public abstract class AbstractCubicTransform<Derived extends AbstractCubicTransform>
extends Object

Transforms an image map to a set of rectilinear images. Used to create a cube map for bigshot.VRPanorama.

          Width in pixels of the output image.

Field Detail

input

protected Image input
The input image map.

vfov

protected double vfov
Vertical field of view of the output image, in radians.

inputVfov

protected double inputVfov
Vertical field of view of the image map, in radians.

inputHfov

protected double inputHfov
Horizontal field of view of the image map, in radians.

horizontalWrap

protected boolean horizontalWrap
True iff the image map wraps horizontally. Should only be true if inputHfov is Math.PI * 2.

inputHorizon

protected int inputHorizon
The pixel row that is at the horizon.

oy

protected double oy
Yaw offset of the bubble in degrees. Used to level the bubble before rotating it and producing the rectilinear image in the direction given by yaw, pitch and roll.

op

protected double op
Pitch offset of the bubble in degrees. Used to level the bubble before rotating it and producing the rectilinear image in the direction given by yaw, pitch and roll.

or

protected double or
Roll offset of the bubble in degrees. Used to level the bubble before rotating it and producing the rectilinear image in the direction given by yaw, pitch and roll.

yaw

protected double yaw
Yaw of the center point of the output image, in degrees.

pitch

protected double pitch
Pitch of the center point of the output image, in degrees.

roll

protected double roll
Roll of the output image, in degrees.

width

protected int width
Width in pixels of the output image.

height

protected int height
Width in pixels of the output image.

oversampling

protected int oversampling
The amount of oversampling done. 1 means no oversampling.

jitter

protected double jitter
Amount of jitter in the oversampling. Defaults to 0.

Method Detail

input

public Derived input(Image input)
Sets the image map. Once set, the transform() method can be called several times with other parameters being adjusted between calls.

input

public Derived input(File input)
                                             throws Exception
Loads the image map from a file. Once set, the transform() method can be called several times with other parameters being adjusted between calls.

Throws:
Exception

fromHuginPto

public Derived fromHuginPto(File ptoFile)
                                                    throws IOException
Loads projection parameters from a Hugin .pto file. Subclasses should override the fromHuginPtoParameters(int, int, double, int, int, int, int) method to actually set the projection parameters.

Parameters:
ptoFile - the Hugin .pto file to read transformation parameters from
Throws:
IOException

fromHuginPtoParameters

public abstract Derived fromHuginPtoParameters(int w,
                                               int h,
                                               double v,
                                               int cropLeft,
                                               int cropRight,
                                               int cropTop,
                                               int cropBottom)
Sets the required projection parameters from the Hugin .pto parameters. The Hugin pto describes an image that is w pixels wide and h pixels tall. It has a horizontal field of view of v degrees. From that image, a sub-rectangle with top-left coordinates (cropLeft, cropTop) and bottom-right coordinates (cropRight, cropBottom) has been rendered and is the actual input image to the projection.

Parameters:
w - the width of the map image, in pixels
h - the height of the map image, in pixels
v - the horizontal field of view, in degrees
cropLeft - the first used column of the image
cropRight - one past the rightmost used column of the image
cropTop - the first used row in the image
cropBottom - one past the bottom-most used row of the image

vfov

public Derived vfov(double vfov)
Sets the vertical field of view.

Parameters:
vfov - the field of view in degrees

inputHorizon

public Derived inputHorizon(int inputHorizon)
Sets y-coordinate of the horizon for the input image.

Parameters:
inputHorizon - y-coordinate of the horizon

inputVfov

public Derived inputVfov(double inputVfov)
Sets the vertical field of view of the input image.

Parameters:
inputVfov - the field of view in degrees

inputVfov

public double inputVfov()
Return the input vertical field of view, in degrees. The result may suffer from rounding errors, as it is stored as radians internally.

inputHfov

public Derived inputHfov(double inputHfov)
Sets the horizontal field of view of the input image. Also sets the horizontalWrap flag if the input FOV is 360.

Parameters:
inputHfov - the field of view in degrees

inputHfov

public double inputHfov()
Return the input horizontal field of view, in degrees. The result may suffer from rounding errors, as it is stored as radians internally.

horizontalWrap

public Derived horizontalWrap(boolean horizontalWrap)
Sets whether the input image wraps around horizontally. This is automatically set to true of the horizontal field of view is set to 360.

Parameters:
horizontalWrap - if set to true, indicates that the input image wraps around horizontally

offset

public Derived offset(double oy,
                      double op,
                      double or)
Sets the initial transform offsets (used to level a bubble).

Parameters:
oy - the yaw angle in degrees
op - the pitch angle in degrees
or - the roll angle in degrees

view

public Derived view(double yaw,
                    double pitch,
                    double roll)
Sets the view direction.

Parameters:
yaw - the yaw angle in degrees
pitch - the pitch angle in degrees
roll - the roll angle in degrees

size

public Derived size(int width,
                    int height)
Sets the output image size in pixels.

oversampling

public Derived oversampling(int oversampling)
If greater than one, oversamples each output pixel using a grid of oversampling * oversampling samples. Use together with jitter(double) to avoid moire and aliasing.

Parameters:
oversampling - the amount of oversampling along each axis of the output image. Must be >= 1.

jitter

public Derived jitter(double jitter)
Adds a random jitter to the sampling. Use together with oversampling(int) to avoid moire and aliasing.

Parameters:
jitter - the jitter, in units of one output pixel

transform

public abstract Image transform()
                         throws Exception
Performs the transformation.

Throws:
Exception

transformToFaces

public File[] transformToFaces(File outputBase)
                        throws Exception
Transforms an image map to six VR cube faces. This method modifies the view (yaw, pitch and roll) values for this transform.

Parameters:
outputBase - the base directory to output the cube faces to
Returns:
the resulting faces as PNG files in the outputBase directory. They are named "face_f.png", "face_r.png", "face_b.png", "face_l.png", "face_u.png" and "face_d.png", for "Front", "Right", "Back", "Left", "Up" and "Down" respectively.
Throws:
Exception

readImage

public static Image readImage(File imageName)
                       throws Exception
Convenience function to load an image from a file.

Parameters:
imageName - the image to load
Returns:
the image
Throws:
Exception

transformToFaces

public static File[] transformToFaces(AbstractCubicTransform xform,
                                      File outputBase,
                                      int outputSize,
                                      double oy,
                                      double op,
                                      double or)
                               throws Exception
Executes a transformation six times to produce six VR cube faces.

Parameters:
xform - the transform to use. Its input must be set.
outputBase - the base directory to output the cube faces to
outputSize - the size (width and height), in pixels, of each face
oy - the initial yaw offset
op - the initial pitch offset
or - the initial roll offset
Returns:
the resulting faces as PNG files in the outputBase directory. They are named "face_f.png", "face_r.png", "face_b.png", "face_l.png", "face_u.png" and "face_d.png", for "Front", "Right", "Back", "Left", "Up" and "Down" respectively.
Throws:
Exception
